1.text: Cover the entire grease spot with liquid dish detergent.

2.text: Work foam from the soap or detergent or shampoo into the stain.
2.vid: /0/0e/Remove Grease or Oil Stains from Clothing Step 7.360p.mp4

3.text: Rinse the area with water first, then optionally, follow with a vinegar rinse.
3.vid: /3/3e/Remove Grease or Oil Stains from Clothing Step 8 Version 4.360p.mp4

4.text: Wash the clothing, alone, with laundry detergent.

5.text: Repeat steps for a persistent grease stain.

6.text: Use a spot remover such as Shout to hit any grease and/or oil stains.
6.vid: /4/43/Remove Grease or Oil Stains from Clothing Step 11 Version 4.360p.mp4

7.text: Meanwhile, bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil.

8.text: Remove the boiling water from the burner and carefully pour the water onto the stains from up high.
8.vid: /3/3b/Remove Grease or Oil Stains from Clothing Step 13.360p.mp4

9.text: Repeat steps for each area of grease/oil.
9.vid: /7/78/Remove Grease or Oil Stains from Clothing Step 14 Version 4.360p.mp4

10.text: Wash the clothing, alone, with laundry detergent.

11.text: Blot away any excess grease or oil with a paper towel.
11.vid: /b/ba/Remove Grease or Oil Stains from Clothing Step 1.360p.mp4

12.text: Cover grease or oil stain generously with baby powder.
12.vid: /f/f0/Remove Grease or Oil Stains from Clothing Step 2 Version 4.360p.mp4

13.text: Remove the baby powder from the clothing with a paper towel or spoon.
13.vid: /a/aa/Remove Grease or Oil Stains from Clothing Step 3 Version 4.360p.mp4

14.text: Work a small amount of hand dishwashing detergent and water into stain with your thumb.
14.vid: /c/c4/Remove Grease or Oil Stains from Clothing Step 4 Version 4.360p.mp4

15.text: Wash the clothing, alone, with laundry detergent.

16.text: Instead of detergent, spray a little WD-40 or lighter fluid onto the clothing.
16.vid: /7/79/Remove Grease or Oil Stains from Clothing Step 16 Version 4.360p.mp4

17.text: Let the WD-40 or lighter fluid set into the clothing for 20 minutes.

18.text: Wash out the WD-40 or lighter fluid by thoroughly soaking the clothing in warm water.

19.text: Wash the clothing, alone, with laundry detergent.
